intro: Heterotoma gibbosa, commonly known as the zigzag grasshopper, is a species of grasshopper found in various parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Pyrgocoryphidae and is characterized by its distinctive, zigzag-shaped markings on its body. The plant it is associated with, though not a plant itself, is often found in grassland habitats where it feeds on vegetation. Its life cycle involves incomplete metamorphosis, with nymphs resembling adults but lacking wings. This species plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat by contributing to nutrient cycling and serving as prey for larger animals.
